title: Sinner meets Verstappen, waves chequered flag at F1 race in Abu Dhabi
description: Jannik Sinner ended the 2024 ATP Tour season by lifting the Nitto ATP Finals trophy and on Sunday, the Italian helped bring the Formula 1 year to a close. Sinner waved the chequered flag at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, the final race of the F1 season. It was an action-packed weekend for the World No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings, who also spent time with renowned driver Max Verstappen and attended the F2/F3 Prize-Giving event. Jannik Sinner attends the F2/F3 Prize-Giving event. Credit: Formula Motorsport Limited Sinner was not the only tennis star in attendance. Grigor Dimitrov, Arthur Cazaux, Aryna Sabalenka, Paula Badosa, Elena Rybakina and Sorana Cirstea also enjoyed their time in Abu Dhabi. Dimitrov shared on his Instagram story a picture of him with actress Eva Longoria. Arthur Cazaux at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. Credit: Arthur Cazaux Earlier this season, Sinner met driver Carlos Sainz in Monte-Carlo, where the Spaniard sat courtside to watch the 23-year-old. Drivers George Russell and Lando Norris also attended the clay-court ATP Masters 1000 event this past April. html:
Italian joined by fellow tennis stars Dimitrov, Sabalenka and more

December 09, 2024

Mark Thompson/Getty Images

Max Verstappen and Jannik Sinner at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday. By ATP Staff

Jannik Sinner ended the 2024 ATP Tour season by lifting the Nitto ATP Finals trophy and on Sunday, the Italian helped bring the Formula 1 year to a close. Sinner waved the chequered flag at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, the final race of the F1 season.

It was an action-packed weekend for the World No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings, who also spent time with renowned driver Max Verstappen and attended the F2/F3 Prize-Giving event.


Jannik Sinner attends the F2/F3 Prize-Giving event. Credit: Formula Motorsport Limited

Sinner was not the only tennis star in attendance. Grigor Dimitrov, Arthur Cazaux, Aryna Sabalenka, Paula Badosa, Elena Rybakina and Sorana Cirstea also enjoyed their time in Abu Dhabi. Dimitrov shared on his Instagram story a picture of him with actress Eva Longoria.


Arthur Cazaux at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. Credit: Arthur Cazaux

Earlier this season, Sinner met driver Carlos Sainz in Monte-Carlo, where the Spaniard sat courtside to watch the 23-year-old. Drivers George Russell and Lando Norris also attended the clay-court ATP Masters 1000 event this past April.

â€” Formula 1 (@F1) December 8, 2024
